Class BCPlot

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  edu.stanford.math.plex.BCPlot
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class BCPlot
extends javax.swing.JPanel

The BCPlot class does simple plotting of PersistenceIntervals.

Version:
$Id$

plot

protected static void plot(java.lang.String legend,
                           double[][] values,
                           double upperBound,
                           boolean forceScatter)
Create the plot window and display results. For thread safety, this method should be invoked from the event-dispatching thread.

doPlot

public static void doPlot(java.lang.String label,
                          double[][] intervals,
                          double upperBound)
Make a barcode plot -- call via Plex.plot().

Parameters:
label - Window label.
intervals - An array of double[2] of [x,y] intervals to plot.
upperBound - Display the range from 0 to upperBound.
See Also:
Plex.plot(edu.stanford.math.plex.PersistenceInterval[], java.lang.String, double)

doScatter

public static void doScatter(java.lang.String label,
                             double[][] intervals,
                             double upperBound)
Make a barcode scatterplot -- call via Plex.scatter().

Parameters:
label - Window label.
intervals - An array of double[2] of x,y points to plot.
upperBound - Display the square from 0 to upperBound.
See Also:
Plex.scatter(edu.stanford.math.plex.PersistenceInterval[], java.lang.String, double)
